mod.description:
A Slay The Spire mod, inspired mostly by SF2's main characters (also other fighting games). 
 
Currently it adds 32 relics (two need The Artist Mod, one is Custom Mode only), 12 custom game modifiers, 1 event and 1 potion, all in English and simplified Chinese. 
 
v1.0 will have 34+ relics. 
 
Most of the images in this mod are temporary and will be substituted/improved on v1.0.

relics.name: "Strongest" Style Manual
relics.description:
At the start of your turn, add a random qcfpunch:Weakest card to your hand.
Your max hand size is increased by 1.
relics.flavorText: "My god, I must unlearn what I've read. WHY WOULD ANYONE FIGHT LIKE THIS?!" | If there's one relic on this mod that will be unfinished, it will be this one.

relics.name: Army Boots
relics.description: The first time your Block is broken each combat, lose 1 Frail, Weak and Vulnerable.
relics.flavorText: Excellent grip. Sadly, not your size.

relics.name: Black Training Shirt
relics.description: At the start of combat, gain 2 Strength. The first time each combat, when you use a Skill card lose 2 Strength.
relics.flavorText: Training is important, even in the Spire.

relics.name: Broken Tusk
relics.description: The first Curse or Status drawn each turn gives one extra 2 damage hit to your Attacks that turn.
relics.flavorText: Some things are very hard to forgive.

relics.name: Red Beret
relics.description: Each combat, the first time you gain Block, draw 2 cards.
relics.flavorText: Used for guiding the enemy attention, then repositioning yourself.

relics.name: Red Headband
relics.description: The first time you draw a Status or Curse each turn, discard it and draw a card.
relics.flavorText: Wearing it gives some focus against distractions.

relics.name: Wrestler's Cloak
relics.description: At the start of Elite and Boss fights, gain 5 Temporary_HP. Right click during your turn to gain 5 Temporary_HP and lose this relic.
relics.flavorText: Never underestimate the power of a good entrance before a fight.

relics.name: Chain With Nametags
relics.description: Whenever you gain Block, gain 34% of it as Temporary_HP instead.
relics.flavorText: A surprisingly resilient chain with two faded nametags.

relics.name: Green Leotard
relics.description: For each card drawn from effects, gain 2 Block.
relics.flavorText: Very unusual, but excellent for moving around unhindered, since nothing can get on the way.

relics.name: Necklace of Skulls
relics.description: When you remove a card, Upgrade a card in your deck. (Won't work with the Vampires event by now)
relics.flavorText: "Hatred begets weakness. Cultivate your heart." Who said that?

relics.name: Red Gi
relics.description: If you play 3 Attacks in a row this turn, draw 1 card. If it's an Attack, it costs 1 less this turn.
relics.flavorText: Made of good fabric that doesn't hinder movements and inspires to be offensive.

relics.name: School Backpack
relics.description: The next 5 combats drop an additional card reward of a non-modded color other than your own.
relics.flavorText: Full of physical mementos from a world tour.

relics.name: Spiky Bracers
relics.description: Each combat, the first 2 Skills played that cost 2 or more cost 1 less.
relics.flavorText: Good for balancing your body weight, but the pointy spikes make you use them sparingly.

relics.name: White Boots
relics.description: Every 3 Attacks drawn, deal 4 damage to the last single enemy attacked. Every upgraded Attack drawn, deal 1 damage to that enemy.
relics.flavorText: Very, very worn shoes... as much from hitting as from walking. | If you dislike all those boots on this mod, you can blame this relic :D

relics.name: Wild Herbs Ointment
relics.description: If you start a combat with more than 30% Max HP and end it with, at most, less 30% Max HP, gain 4 Max HP.
relics.flavorText: Made from herbs commonly found in siberian climate. Good for deep cuts and lacerations.

relics.name: Combat Fatigues
relics.description: At the start of your turn, if you gained Block and didn't play Attacks last turn, gain 2 Temporary Strength and your next Attack deals double damage.
relics.flavorText: "Not made for peace. Remember to take them off eventually, will ya?" - Ranwid

relics.name: Duffel Bag
relics.description: At the next 4 non event non boss fights won, gain respectively 1 Bandage Up, 1 Panacea and at the last 2, 1 random common relic.
relics.flavorText: Very practical when wandering. | The CHAMPION in terms of bugs fixed on this mod.

relics.name: Fighting Gloves
relics.description: Starts with 1 charge. At Rest Sites, you can use all charges to Upgrade a card per charge, as a free choice (if chosen first). Each 4 rooms, gain 1 charge.
relics.flavorText: "Inspiring! Who wants to train with me?" - Ranwid.

relics.name: Handcuffs
relics.description: Each combat, the first enemy that receives unblocked damage gains 2 qcfpunch:Unsteady and is qcfpunch:Stunned for 1 turn.
relics.flavorText: An old tool used for those who once fought for law and order.

relics.name: Lotus Statue
relics.description: Right click at a Rest Site before picking an option to remove at most 1 card per charge spent. Gain 1 charge when you remove a card without using this relic's effect. (Won't work with the Vampires event by now)
relics.flavorText: "Meditate now... Then the answers you seek will be revealed."

relics.name: Red Cyclone Teachings
relics.description: Each combat, the first 2 Attacks used that cost 3-or-more Stun their target(s), then Exhaust.
relics.flavorText: "'Because in Mother Russia, YOU nail the bears down!' ...what's Russia, what are bears and what's a mother?" - Ranwid.

relics.name: Special Ops Insignia
relics.description: Once each turn, if you draw 4 cards by effects in a turn, add Setup and Forethought with Ethereal and Exhaust to your hand.
relics.flavorText: A solid set-up, a knack for improvisation and a decisive resolution are all part of the job.

relics.name: Unceasing Flame
relics.description: Right click during combat: your next Attack's single target loses HP as the damage caused (min of 2 HP). Recharges every 6 Attacks.
relics.flavorText: "Glorious! A divine fire of a daring dragon, if the ancient texts are right." - Ranwid.

relics.name: Extra Skeleton
relics.description: Gain 1 Buffer every 5 turns.
relics.flavorText: It's not the REAL skeleton breaking, so it's fine. Really!

relics.name: Neverending Blood
relics.description: The first 7 times you lose HP, increase your Regen at most to 1/3 of the lost HP. Regains 2 uses when healing outside of combat.
relics.flavorText: There's so much blood inside now, that it almost feels like it can leak out. | The complicated cousing of Extra Skeleton.

relics.name: Rainbow Brush
relics.description: Every 5 cards played, add this turn's randomized card to your hand. It costs 1-less and has Ethereal (won't cost 0) or Exhaust, unless it's a Status or Curse.
relics.flavorText: Red Blue paints, the clouds pierce Darkness blocks twin star Nothing until the cycle restarts | The development of this was a long struggle of having hype with the idea, realizing that it was horrible, and then polishing and repolishing it until it was ok. Lesson learned: personal hype != good idea.

relics.name: Crimson Sash
relics.description: Gain [E] at the start of your turn. You recover 50% less HP from healing.
relics.flavorText: A grim reminder that no matter how skilled, no one avoids their own end forever.

relics.name: Dark Gi
relics.description: When you spend [E] to play a card, draw a card. Lose 35% of your Max HP.
relics.flavorText: A master of the fist's power is hard to wield. | Thanks for The Bartender for inspiring this one :)

relics.name: Killian Engine Alpha
relics.description: Upon pickup, obtain up to 5 from 25 random cards of other classes. Then, remove the same amount of cards from your deck.
relics.flavorText: Here, a vast amount of fighting information rests. | Thanks for Aspiration which inspired multi-color shenanigans :)

relics.name: Cattail
relics.description: Upon pickup and after 7 rooms, obtain 1 Smoke Bomb.
relics.flavorText: It feels like it shouldn't be here, and that meaning becomes solid in your hands.

potions.name: New Challenger Coin
potions.description: The next floor non-combat rooms you can normally go will be, instead, Elite rooms.
